question_text: In a war of ideas, it is people who get killed. Does a common man suffer from a groups ideology? Express your opinion and support the same with reasons and examples.
question_answer:
Since ages, humankind is at war with each other owing to opposing ideas, ideologies, and beliefs. A famous quote In a war of ideas, it is people who get killed comes true when an ordinary man and his family suffer because of ideological conflict. I support this statement. This essay focuses on the effect of a groups ideology on the common man.

The War of Ideas is a clash of opposing ideas, ideologies, or concepts through which groups use strategic influence to promote their interests abroad. In this war of ideas, it is the common man and his family who suffers the most. They have to live in constant fear of losing their family, livelihood, money, resources and most importantly, loss of life.

Political war is a perfect example to support my view. The ruling government uses a variety of techniques to weaken or destroy an opponents political, social, or societal will. In many cases, political war is combined with violence which causes a significant loss to ordinary people or with wrong decisions by government.

The collapse of Hosni Mubaraks government in Egypt provides relevant examples, as neither likely would have happened absent the popular revolt. The anti-government protest is followed by a series of attacks on Christians and churches which killed many people and many were forcibly evicted from their homes making them live in constant fear. This would not have happened if the difference in political and religious streams of thought did not exist in the Arab worlds most populous country.

To conclude, it is right to say that people get killed where the conflict in ideas exist. Everyones welfare should be considered before holding on any plan.

question_text: Some effective people like repetitive routine, such as eating the same food, do you like this way?
question_answer:
Some people prefer following the same routine everyday like eating the same food for breakfast, reading books at a particular time and likewise. From TV stars to supermodels, a solid daily routine is a key to success. I would avoid being repetitive in my daily life and avoid following a course of action.

Repetitive behaviors or routines are essential to many active people as it allows better control of everyday life or a process, but consequently, it restricts the minds ability to improve beyond certain limits. Acting or behaving in a limited framework makes the person lazy as it causes us to lose our interest in adopting new habits. When anyone locks oneself in a pattern or routine, he/she refuses to change.

Many experts believe that changing a routine or moving between two activities, can be distressing for some people and it significantly increased their refusal of the challenge. What I find is, avoiding routine can have numerous benefits on the well-being of the mind and overall personality of the individual. When we shake up the routine, we opt to do one thing differently. For the right reasons, sometimes a different perspective is all we need to change the particular process or situation. By restricting my freedom of action, I do not want to restrict my mind from enriching the knowledge base.

For example, every day I listen to music from different genres to diversify my experience of music and to stimulate my mind. To conclude, though routine offers a sense of security by constructing a comfort zone, I like to challenge personal stabilization and ask for unusual experience in my daily life.

question_text: In this technological world, the number of new inventions has been increasing. Please describe a new invention, and explain whether it will bring advantages or disadvantages.
question_answer:
The controversial topic with respect to new inventions such as smartphones never fails to attract public attention. While some people think that smartphones bring huge benefits, on the other end of the spectrum others hold the view that the importance of smartphones is overrated. In my opinion, both opinions are reasonable due to functional apps and social isolation.

First and foremost, it is evidently reasonable for one to think that smartphones play a crucial role in modern society on account of a wide variety of useful apps. To be specific, Twitter and Facebook make communication easier; Google Maps enable drivers to get to their destinations and avoid traffic jams. Moreover, people can have access to their information and files by using online storage apps such as Google Drive and Dropbox. For example, a recent article published in The Economist states, Australians spend over 4 hours per day on their smartphones. Thus, it is clearly shown that smartphones have become an indispensable part of life.

However, the negative consequences of smartphones such as social isolation cannot be ignored. This is because phones can be addictive, and spending too much time on them can make people socially isolated from the real world. For instance, according to a recent study conducted by the University of Melbourne, 46% of adolescents in Australia who are using smartphones in large amounts have been less sociable and less active. Without a doubt, it is clearly shown that the widespread use of communications apps and social media on phones has adversely affected ones ability to converse in real life.  

In a nutshell, for the aforementioned reasons, I wholeheartedly endorse that the smartphone is a double-edged sword. To address this, governments and societies should make a concerted effort to find a balance.

question_text: There is no need for newspapers in the modern world. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
question_answer:
In the contemporary world, an ethical and business competition between the digital and print media is quite visible. The future of print media in the digital era is a debatable issue. Though some people hold the opinion that the popularity of printed newspaper will exist in the forthcoming days, my two cents is this print news portal will soon disappear to make way for the digital form of getting news.

One apparent reason for my viewpoint is that online portals and e-newspapers are gaining broad acceptance by its sophisticated features such as clarity, video sharing, social sharing, and instant opinion sharing tools. Over and above, the public goes by online news portals than print versions to get immediate and breaking news. The vast popularity of online editions of the newspapers is the best epitome. When an Internet user can browse virtually any newspaper in the world for free, why should he spend money on reading only a particular newspaper which does not have last hour breaking news?

Some would argue that there is a different appeal to holding a printed newspaper than reading on the computer screen. Thats true, but they should compare the old way of sending letters to the latest email technology. The number of emails people send on an average is million times higher than the traditional postal mails and similarly, reading a newspaper would become a tradition of the past while online news portals would dominate the world.

In conclusion, the newspaper will soon get its place in history. We can expect many new trends in future not only in the case of the newspaper but also in other printed media, and that is obvious with the widespread acceptance of technology and its popularity among the young generation.

question_text: Space travel is fantastic these days, but there are many issues  such as environmental problems  that we should be focusing on. What are your views on the allocation of public funding?
question_answer:
Many times people think why we are spending so much on space travel when we have so many problems here that need to be addressed now. Here in this essay, I am discussing both sides of space travel versus current crucial issues faced by the human.

Exploration, being an important survival strategy helps in evolution. The ever-growing Worlds population and the pressure to feed it may be forcing humans to look out for new food sources. The environmental changes, climate change, and other factors are causing humans to seek safe habitats. According to me, these might be the reasons why space travels interest so much to us.

Space travel is allowing us to explore outside earth surroundings and get a better insight into the world we are living in. By knowing our surrounding in minute details, scientists are trying to find a possible solution to current crucial problems faced by us. The advanced prediction of weather and natural disasters are significant achievements in space exploration.

On the other hand spending so much on space travel seems wastage when people here on earth are in dire need of it. Natural resource depletion, global warming, ocean acidification and changing weather patterns require our immediate attention. The launch of a space shuttle is millions of dollar. For example, The MESSENGER mission costs $280 million. This considerable expenditure done on space exploration programs can, in turn, be utilized to enrich lives here.

To conclude, sending people outside the planet may be the best way to persuade people to save planet earth. Money alone cant resolve all our problems.

question_text: Some people think placing advertisements in school is a great resource for public schools that need additional funding, but others think it exploits children by treating them as a captive audience for corporate sponsors. Choose which position you most agree with and discuss why you choose that position. Support your point of view with details from your own experiences, observations or reading.
question_answer:
Advertising has become the most popular media resource in the competitive market. There are some analysts hold an opinion that the public schools are better places to advertise to increase the funds for the schools, while others consider that it will cause to children to be exploited it will make them as captive audiences. That essay will assertion both side of the contentions before deducing a reasonable conclusion.

Many people speak not to place advertisements to increase funds in public schools. First and foremost, troubled juveniles could be a significant factor. It is generally seen that when companies place the substantial colorful advertisement in school, children would more focus on advertisement and they would put less concentrate on studies. For instance, the majority of the businesses are placing advertisements in schools to focus more students attraction for their products. Therefore, if pupils do not have enough money to fulfill their requirements, they might get involved in some criminals activities.

Some groups are in favor of placing advertisements to increase fund in public schools in spite of views discussed above regarding not to placing advertisements in public school. An increasing number of facilities could be a substantial reason behind the opponent's viewpoint. Nowadays, businesses spent thousands of dollars on reaching their competitive market. Therefore, if they can place advertisements in the right place, they would pay more than usual, for example, sponsoring for new buildings and equipment.

In last, undoubtedly, whether placing advertisements in public school or not is always a matter of discussion; however, as far as I am concerned, advertisements should be banned in the school environment and we should make better and serene environment for kids in schools.

question_text: It is important to preserve the beautiful buildings of the past, even if it will be expensive to do so. To what extent do you agree or disagree with it.
question_answer:
Beautiful architectures and monuments often add to the appearance of the city and improve its aesthetic value. Further, if the site has some significant historical event associated with it, then it becomes further imperative to preserve such a landmark. However, it is often observed that time takes its toll on any artifact and this is particularly true with buildings subject to all moods of the weather. Lives of such vital structures can be increased and even the action of natural elements revered if timely repairs and reconstructions are undertaken as soon as the need arises. In my opinion, such beautiful structures that are a part of the citys heritage should be preserved to allow the new generations to connect with the citys cultural past.

The repairs and preservation come at a cost which grows exponentially year over year. The real question that we need to ask is, who should bear this ever-increasing price? Firstly, whatever is good for the society, such as the monuments in question, should be taken care of by the people or their representatives. Who represents the people of a particular place better than its elected government? Therefore, the government should direct funds explicitly aimed at preserving and uplifting the state of these beautiful historic structures. Secondly, if the building already forms a part of some private property, then the government should direct the funds to the owner of the same. Further, to prevent misuse of the funds, the government should appoint a committee to oversee the appropriation of the funds.

In conclusion, beautiful historical buildings must be preserved to safeguard the cultural heritage of our cities, and the cost associated with repairs and preservation should come from the government.

question_text: In some countries around the world, voting is compulsory. Do you agree with the notion of compulsory voting?
question_answer:
The topic of compulsory voting in a democratic society as prevalent in over twenty nations is undeniably a controversial topic. Under the mandatory voting system, the eligible citizens, often starting at age 18 register for and participate in the democratic election of representatives. While many disagree with the notion of compulsory voting, I am in favor of it.

The practice of compulsory voting results in higher voter turnout and produce governments with more stability, legitimacy and a genuine mandate to govern. The most beneficial aspect of it is an informed citizen, an enhanced caliber of representatives and better decisions. The system as a whole not only benefits offices and also helps all individuals.

For instance, one of the most well-known compulsory voting systems is in Australia. Before the 1924 compulsory voting law, the voter turnout was as low as 47% which soon jumped to between 91% and 96%. Some people perceived advantages to mandatory voting are the stimulation of broader interest politics, as a sort of civic education and political stimulation, which creates a better-informed population. In Australis, the voters who do not turn up could face a moderate fine while, in some countries like Belgium, the voters who dont turn up could face prosecution or harsh punitive action.

In a nutshell, it is saying that a mandatory voting system in a democratic society is beneficial. However, its implication in a friendly manner is of vital importance. Like compulsory education, voting should also make mandatory for a democracy to be a democracy.

question_text: Do you think consumers should avoid over-packaged products or is it the responsibility of manufacturers to avoid extra packaging? Give your views or any relevant examples based on your own experience.
question_answer:
The packaging of products serves many functions. The foremost is to make things easy to carry by the end-user. Although the packaging is essential to make things more convenient, sometimes the consumer gets annoyed by the over-packing of products. I am of the view that consumer should avoid over packed products as often it is purely marketing. In this article, I will further explain my viewpoint with an example.

Recently I visited a supermarket to find plastic-wrapped bananas. In my view bananas already come with their natural, biodegradable cover so what is the need for this extra packaging. When I inquired from the companys customer service, they reverted that it keeps bananas fresh for long. I feel this excess plastic packaging makes the company eligible to charge more for the same fruit.

Simply put, some products are unnecessarily over packed to make more money from the consumer. Also, some products cover is specially designed to give the false perception of higher value to the consumer. The consumer should avoid buying products that tend to be over packed.

Instead, we can always carry our bag to the supermarket to buy regular grocery or fruits to the home. If a consumer feels like any product is over-packed, then he/she can replace the product with another comparable brand or company. This way we can show our support to brand/company opting for less packaging or go-green plan.

To conclude, we should always opt for minimal, fully recyclable and compostable packaging. It is the responsibility of both consumer and manufacturers to go greenway and choose for minimal packaging whenever possible.

question_text: In your opinion, what are the advantages and disadvantages of extreme or adventure sports?
question_answer:
The controversial topic with respect to whether extreme or adventure sports have advantages or disadvantages never fails to attract public attention. While some people think that extreme sports offer the freedom of physically and psychologically challenging yourself to perform feats that may make other athletes queasy, on the other end of the spectrum, others hold the view that many extreme sports have an element of danger beyond the risks associated with traditional sports. In my opinion, I strongly believe that these kinds of sports are a double-edged sword, because they provide us with thrilling experiences as well as risks.

First and foremost, it is evidently reasonable for one to think that it is beneficial to do extreme sports on account of the thrilling experiences. Although the potential negative impacts of this kind of sports should be taken into consideration, I still maintain that doing extreme sports has tremendously enriched peoples lives in various ways. For example, a recent article published in The Economist States, Pursuing adventure and excitement is the key to maintaining psychological satisfaction. Thus, it is clearly shown that doing extreme sports can help individuals add excitement to their lives.

However, the high degree of risks cannot be ignored. This is because those who participate in extreme sports, such as bungee-jumping, extreme skiing and sky-diving, risk broken bones, head trauma and even death. For instance, according to a study conducted by the Hongkong University, 38% of the extreme sports athletes died or suffered from serious injuries last year. Without a doubt, it is clearly shown that engagement in extreme or adventure sports involves a high degree of risks.

In a nutshell, for the aforementioned thrill and high degree of risks, I wholeheartedly endorse that there are both advantages and disadvantages in doing extreme or adventure sports.

 Extreme or adventure sports are beneficial on account of thrilling experience.

 The adrenaline flow stimulates the release of dopamine and endorphin, which are associated with feelings of pleasure and euphoria.
 -        核心论点3：增强身体素质
 Extreme sports provide a full-body workout and help people keep fit. 
 By pushing the body’s limits, people can burn up calories while also improving the balance, endurance, and muscle strength.
 -核心论点4：开阔视野
 Extreme or adventure sports are beneficial because it helps to expand people’s life experience.
 The unique life experience from practising extreme sports can broaden people’s horizon.

There are many disadvantages of doing extreme or adventure sports.

question_text: Some people think the law changes our behavior. Do you agree or disagree?
question_answer:
Law, in general, is written rules and regulations that are meant for individuals or groups of the society. Law was created, and intended, to guide and shape behavior. I believe law affects peoples behavior. The punishment or reward associated with law causes people to change their behavior.

Law is for the betterment of society and individuals. The consequences of obeying or disobeying laws impacts people in their everyday lives. Thereby, the law influences how people behave with others in society. Breaking the law would mean trouble. This fear of consequences makes people behave in both their social and professional capacities. For example, earlier male homosexual acts were a crime in many nations, and now with advancement in law, people are now accepting gay members and open about their sexuality.

Many times, people experience legal problems, and these legal problems can impact negatively on their living areas. The mental harassment can bring considerable adverse consequences like going against the system. On the other hand, the law to ensure womens rights makes the women feel equal and safe in society thus bringing a positive change in their behavior. In this sense, laws do influences people behavior in very significant ways.

In conclusion, as a result of facing possible penalties, people are forced to behave responsibly and do good to others and society. Obey the law and get the reward. The law continually changes our behavior and perception toward many things in our daily lives consciously and unconsciously.

question_text: With enough amount of motivation and practice, people can learn anything that the experts teach in the classroom. Do you agree or not?
question_answer:
Throughout the World, everyone sees classroom education and training as the key factors to a good future and hence prosperity. However, with the right amount of motivation and practice, any individual can attain that knowledge that the experts teach in the classroom.

Motivation is what makes all the difference between waking up and going again to bed. In fact, right kind and the right amount of motivation is essential to learning because engaging in education and absorbing knowledge is an active process requiring learners conscious effort. Even the students learning in classrooms need the motivation to pay attention to what their teachers are teaching. What the individual need is to set standards and goals and exert some effort.

For example, when an individual has a keen interest in learning how computer users interact with computer networks than he/she makes an effort to gain mastery in the IT field. Usually, the things that we enjoy is characterized by high energy, self-determination, and better involvement. The self-motivation dont let the person settle for less and crave for more knowledge through e-learning, books, guidance, and self-practice. As he/she enjoys the learning about IT so returns to the activity voluntarily and try to practice beyond basic skills that are often taught in classrooms bound environment. Choosing and practicing the subject of ones own interest rather than compelled to do it makes all the difference in skilled labors and leaders.

To conclude, it is nor the teachers neither classrooms but the environment in which the learning takes place. Its ones own individual attributes and motivation that can teach one better than the training given to him in classrooms by teachers.

question_text: Senior executives should get their employees involved in the decision making process. What is your opinion in this?
question_answer:
The controversial topic with respect to whether executives should get their employees involved in the decision-making process never fails to attract public attention. While some people think that employees should at least have the right to vote in this process, on the other end of the spectrum others hold the view that their involvement in the process will lead to bad decision-making. In my opinion, I strongly agree that engaging them in this process is not a wise choice because they will slow down this process and result in negative consequences.

First and foremost, it is evidently reasonable for one to think that a wise employer should never let his employees join this process on account of wasting too much time. Although the potential positive impacts of getting them involved should be taken into consideration, I still maintain that their absence in the process can tremendously benefit companies in various ways. For example, a recent article published in The Economist states, Companies that involve employees in their decision making 10 times slower to execute on it than those who dont. Thus, it is clearly shown that the presence of too many people is not beneficial for the decision-making process. 

Furthermore, the potential negative result also adds weight to my argument. This is because employees, most of the time, are not as informed as their senior executives. For instance, according to a recent study conducted by HKU, 90% of decisions made by employees were baseless, and consequently led to undesirable results. Without doubt, it is clearly shown that employees are not capable of making well-informed decisions for their companies.

In a nutshell, for the aforementioned wasting time and bad results, I wholeheartedly endorse that employees should not be included in the decision-making processes.

 Involving employees in decision-making process is a good example of the flat management structure, which can largely enhance the efficiency of the communication within a group.

 Employees believe they are partly contributed to the final decision and would make more efforts to help execute the decision.

question_text: Nowadays television has become an essential part of life. It is a medium for disseminating news and information, and for some it acts as a companion. What is your opinion about this?
question_answer:
The controversial topic with respect to whether television has become an essential part of life never fails to attract public attention. While some people think that television is a medium for disseminating news and information, others hold the view that television acts as a companion. Personally speaking, I strongly agree that television provides both knowledge and entertainment, especially for those of older ages. 

First and foremost, it is evidently reasonable for one to think that TV is a key source of information as it provides various news and updates. Although the potential negative impacts of television should be taken into consideration, I still maintain that TV has tremendously enriched peoples lives in various ways. For example, a recent article published in The Economist states, 90% of events happening throughout the world are reported earliest on television. Thus, it is clearly shown that television is a channel where people can receive information efficiently. 

Furthermore, the entertainment value adds weight to my argument. This is because television often provides a broad range of interesting programs that appeal to all age groups. For instance, according to a recent study conducted by the University of Melbourne, 97% of the elderly who had access to television reported that it was their main channel to pass time more easily, and felt less lonely than those who did not have a TV at home. Without a doubt, television can be a source of emotional companionship. 

In a nutshell, for the aforementioned reasons, I wholeheartedly endorse that television is both a channel for accessing information, and a source of entertainment that provides company. To address this issue, governments and societies should make a concerted effort to improve television programs.

question_text: In the past 100 years, there have been many inventions such as antibiotics, airplanes and computers. What do you think is the most important of them? Why?
question_answer:
The controversial topic with respect to what is the most important invention never fails to attract public attention. Personally speaking, computers are the most important invention of these three, because computers improve relationships and improve people`s mental health.

On one hand, the first reason for my argument is that computers can be seen as communication technology to strengthen relationships. This is reasonable because computers equipped with tools of online chatting enable people to maximize their communication whenever and wherever people need.  According to a recent research conducted by Monash University, which indicates that 98 percent of International students use Wechat in computers to contact their parents and friends, computers can be seen as communication technology to strengthen relationships.

On the other hand, the second reason for my argument is that playing computer games is an effective way of improving mental wellbeing. This is reasonable because playing computer games could be a way of reducing stress and anxiety, which means playing computer games provide people with an awesome opportunity to relieve their build-up of tension from lives. According to a recent study conducted by Oxford University, 87 percent of depressed patients feel relaxed and get better after playing video games, playing computer games is an effective way of improving mental wellbeing. 

In conclusion, computers are the most important inventions of these three, because computers improve relationships and improve people`s mental health.

question_text: Large shopping malls are replacing small shops. What is your opinion about this? Discuss with appropriate examples.
question_answer:
The controversial topic with respect to larger malls replacing smaller shops never fails to attract public attention. While some people think that this replacement will cause overcrowding in malls, on the other end of the spectrum, others hold the view that it is a positive change. Having always believed that an expanding range of large malls has more boons than banes, I tend to be the advocate regarding this issue due to a more efficient shopping experience and lower product costs.

First and foremost, it is evidently reasonable for one to think that larger malls are superior to small shops on account of the one-stop shopping experience. Granted that its pivotal to be aware of potentially negative impacts of big centers, I still maintain that big malls have tremendously enriched peoples lives in various ways. For example, a recent article published in The Economist states, 90% of people choose to go to shopping centers rather than their local stores because the wider access to products means they can complete more of their purchases in one go, thus saving time. It is hence clearly shown that large shopping centers provide a more efficient way to shop. 

Furthermore, the lower product costs also add weight to my argument. Conventional wisdom has it that ultimately the aim of the economy is to make products more affordable and raise standards of living. For instance, findings of recent research conducted at the University of Melbourne revealed that large malls create greater competition between suppliers, which in turn reduces prices of goods. Without a doubt, this demonstrates that large malls generate lower prices and thus increase consumers spending power. 

In a nutshell, for the aforementioned better experience and lower costs, I wholeheartedly endorse that small shops are gradually replaced by larger malls.

question_text: With the increase of digital media available online, the role of the library has become obsolete. Universities should only procure digital materials rather than constantly update textbooks. Discuss both the advantages and disadvantages of this position and give your own point of view.
question_answer:
The controversial topic with respect to learning materials never fails to attract public attention. While some people think that textbooks act as better educational materials than new digital materials, on the other end of the spectrum, others hold the opposite view. In my opinion, I strongly believe that both opinions are reasonable due to learning efficiency and eye care.

First and foremost, it is evidently reasonable for one to think that digital materials are superior to textbooks on account of learning efficiency. To be more specific, the ease of carrying electronic devices around and its high-tech functions bring higher efficiency and effectiveness. For example, a recent article published in The Economist states, Users of those high-tech materials have the capability to realise complex operations with a screen touch, making learning process additionally efficient. Thus, it is clearly shown that learning experience and capability would be improved by choosing those digital over paper-based educational materials.

However, the merits of books cannot be ignored. This is because traditional materials can avoid technical problems and potential eye strain. For instance, according to a recent study conducted by the University of Melbourne, 46% of primary school students in China are wearing glasses due to frequent use of digital devices. Without a doubt, it is clearly shown that paper-based textbooks should be taken into consideration as it can prevent myopia.

In a nutshell, for the aforementioned reasons, I wholeheartedly endorse that both digital and written materials should be recommended. To address this, universities should make a concerted effort to provide both to enhance the learning experience.

 Electronbic Books are much cheaper to buy and more environmentally friendly to produce

question_text: Do you think cashless society is realistic and why? What are the advantages and disadvantages? / There are more and more situations where credit cards are used instead of cash. The idea of a cashless society seems to be becoming more of a reality. How realistic do you think it is? What do you see as the potential benefits or problems?
question_answer:
The controversial topic with respect to a cashless society never fails to attract public attention. While some people that that it is realistic and beneficial, on the other end of the spectrum, others hold the view that it is problematic. In my opinion, a cashless society is completely realistic, and it brings more benefit than harm. 

First and foremost, it is evidently reasonable for one to believe that becoming completely cashless is realistic on account of the range of cashless payment technologies these days. To be more specific, the use of credit cards, mobile payments, Apple pay, and so on is becoming more widespread. For example, a recent article published in The Economist states, Over the last year, the proportion of businesses that use electronic payment equipment increased from 54% to 93%. It is thus clearly shown that a cashless society is entirely realistic. 

In addition, the benefits of being cashless should be further considered. Although the potential negative impacts of non-cash payment methods, such as personal information security risks, should be taken into consideration, I still maintain that cashless technologies have tremendously enriched peoples lives in various ways. This includes the increased convenience from not having to carry cash around, and also the better tracking of expenditure. For instance, according to a recent study conducted by the University of Melbourne, people who use credit cards or online payment methods can view all their spending records easily, and thus better manage their finances. Without a doubt, this demonstrates that a cashless society has more boons than banes. 

In a nutshell, for the aforementioned reasons, I wholeheartedly endorse that a cashless society is realistic and beneficial. To address this, governments and societies should make a concerted effort to improve cashless technologies.

question_text: The disadvantages of tourism in less developed countries is as great as the advantages. What is your opinion? / In developing countries, tourism has disadvantages and advantages. Discuss both sides.
question_answer:
The controversial topic with respect to tourism in developing countries never fails to attract public attention. While some people think that it is a key source of income and employment, on the other end of the spectrum, others hold the view that tourism can also be a source of problems. In my opinion, I believe that tourism in less developed countries is a double-edged sword, because it brings in money as well as neglect of other forms of income-generation.

First and foremost, it is evidently reasonable for one to think that tourism often plays a pivotal role in developing countries on account of the income it can generate. Although the potential negative impacts of tourism should also be taken into consideration, I still maintain that it has tremendously enriched peoples lives in various ways. For example, a recent article published in The Economist states, In some countries, over 65% of the revenue was generated by the tourism sector. Thus, it is clearly shown that tourism is indispensable for less-developed countries.

However, the overdependence on tourism cannot be ignored. This is because it can leave the country vulnerable to economic ruin in the long run and can contribute to political upheaval or natural disasters. For instance, according to a recent study conducted by HKU, 90% of the developing countries that rely heavily on tourism went into economic recession this year due to the widespread impact of the COVID-19. Without doubt, it is clearly shown that lacking forms of income-generation other than tourism can cause serious financial issues and risks.

In a nutshell, for the aforementioned financial benefits and potential risk, I wholeheartedly endorse that there both advantages and disadvantages of tourism in developing countries. To address, governments should make an effort to carefully manage the tourism industry in their country.

question_text: The advanced medical technology expands humans life. Do you think it is a curse or blessing?
question_answer:
The controversial topic with respect to advancing medical technologies never fails to attract public attention. While some people think that lifespan extension is a blessing, on the other end of the spectrum, others hold the view that it is a curse. In my opinion, I believe an extended life has more boons than banes, due to the following reasons. 

First and foremost, it is evidently reasonable for one to think that a longer life is positive, on account of the added time it provides. Although the potential negative impacts of an ageing population, such as increased pressure on governments and medical systems, should be taken into consideration, I still maintain that life-extending technologies have tremendously enriched peoples lives in various ways. To be more specific, an extended lifespan not only means staying longer with family, but also more time to fulfill life goals. For example, a recent article published in The Economist states, Those older than 70 reported feeling more fulfilled in their careers and family life. It is thus clearly shown that an increased lifespan allows greater personal fulfillment. 

Furthermore, the contributions to the world also add weight to my argument. This is because with a longer life, scientists can invent more, scholars can write more, and so on. For instance, according to a recent study conducted by Hong Kong University, More than half of new academic research were contributed by those of older ages. Without a doubt, this demonstrates that longevity gives people time to continue contributing their talent and wisdom to the world.

In a nutshell, due to the aforementioned reasons, I wholeheartedly endorse that the higher life expectancy given by medical technologies is a blessing to mankind. To address this, governments and societies should make a concerted effort to support the advancement of medical technologies.

Advanced medical technologies that extend human life brings more harm than good.

 -核心论点2：医疗系统的负担

question_text: The Importance of cars and airplane in modern life. Give examples.
question_answer:
The controversial topic with respect to cars and aeroplanes never fails to attract public attention. There has been a heated debate on whether cars and aeroplanes are important in modern life. As far as I am concerned, I tend to be the advocate regarding this issue.

It is evidently reasonable for me to believe that these transportation means hold a vital place in this day and age due to the fact that they make our life easier and provide us with a superior living standard. This is because with their efficient transportation capability, not only the productivity and effectiveness of our society are improved, but they provide more choices of consumer goods and allow international trading. To illustrate this, the acceleration of globalisation would be a convincing example. As a result, cars and aeroplanes virtually shrink the world; thus, we can enjoy a higher living standard.

In contrast, it is commonly believed as a fact the pollution they cause which contributes to global warming and climate change is alarming and should never be overlooked. Nevertheless, this argument does not hold water. It should be pointed out that, aside from transportation, cars and aeroplanes have solved numerous global issues and act like life savers.  That is to say, they can serve as the role of lifesavers to rescue people from danger, transport food and supplies to those who are in need and help to tackle the problem of poverty and hunger.

In a nutshell, due to the mentioned reasons, we may safely reach the conclusion that cars and aeroplanes are of the utmost importance among the inventions for the last century. Despite the fact that it may be culpable for pollutions, the merits of improving living standards and the role of lifesavers are more prominent.

question_text: Should universities assess students based on regular assignments instead of a final exam?
question_answer:
The controversial topic with respect to assessments never fails to attract public attention. There has been a heated debate on whether universities should assess students based on regular assignments instead of a final exam. As far as I am concerned, I tend to be the advocate regarding this issue. 

It is evidently reasonable for me to believe that offering regular assignments is a better option due to the fact that it results in better learning outcomes. This is because this practice breaks the task up into parts and sets time intervals between assessments, which motivates students to prepare and revise the learning material on a regular basis. To illustrate this, a monthly quiz is a convincing example. As a result, students tend to develop the time-management skill and be more persistent.

In contrast, it is commonly believed as a fact that Final Exams are measurable and easy to operate. Nevertheless, this argument does not hold water. It should be pointed out that consistent assessment is a better reflection of ones true ability. That is to say, Final exams cause an intense environment, which will have a mental burden and affect one's performance. Therefore, average performance tends to be a better indication.

In a nutshell, due to the mentioned reasons, we may safely reach the conclusion that regular assessments are more suitable. Despite the fact that they are not easy to operate, they can help students develop time-management skill and reflect ones true ability.

question_text: Discuss the consequence of slow birth rate and aging population and give solutions.
question_answer:
In the contemporary society, governments are faced with a downward trend in fertility and an increase in the share of older individuals. In this essay, I am going to investigate the consequence of ageing population and then offer some solutions. 

It is evidently reasonable for some to believe that the consequence of ageing population can be devastating. This is because an increasing number of elderly people impose substantial pressure on the economy and the health care system. Indeed, the more people retire, the more onerous the pension burden the state has to carry. This may hurt economic growth and the overall quality of life because more public spending is diverted from education and infrastructure investment to finance programs for the elderly. What is more, the labour force also suffers due to the shortage of productive workers who often make the most significant contribution to society.

On the basis of the above consequence, the solutions to this problem should also be many.  Governments have the responsibility and obligation to take some actions. Firstly, medical advances and health programmes might allow older adults to stay healthy and work for longer. Secondly, people should be rewarded by having more children. At last, importing immigrants is also a viable choice for increasing the young workforce.

In a nutshell, I think the issues of the ageing population can be solved one day in the future. Additionally, I would suggest that it seems highly wise and vital for the government to implement those mentioned pertinent and prompt policy solutions.

question_text: Should the government provide financial support in the health or education sectors? Discuss.
question_answer:
The controversial topic with respect to financial support never fails to attract public attention. There has been a heated debate on whether governments should provide free health care or free education. As far as I am concerned, I tend to believe that governments should attach heavier weight to health care. 

It is reasonable to believe that governments should give priority to health care due to the fact that public health is the key determinant of a good quality of life, and it is the governments responsibility to provide standard healthcare. This is because government budgets are raised by taxing working people, and thus citizens should be the primary beneficiaries. To illustrate this, income tax is a convincing example. Additionally, it is the welfare of seeing doctors for free that has significantly reduced citizens expenditures on health, thus saving their costs of living. As a result, their living standard has improved. 

In contrast, it is commonly believed that education is an essential factor for a countrys development because educated workers lay the foundation for a countrys economic growth.  Nevertheless, this argument does not hold water. It should be pointed out that governments have the full responsibilities for supporting the poor to have equal access to the medical treatment. That is to say, it is inhumane to refuse to help someone dying based on the condition that they cannot afford medical services. This will result in social injustice and is unfavourable for maintaining social order. 

In a nutshell, due to the mentioned reasons, we may safely reach the conclusion that medical care should be made freely available for every citizen. Despite the fact that educated people are the backbones of a countrys development, physical fitness is the fundamental need for a person and should be enjoyed by every individual.

question_text: Some people emigrate and move to a foreign country, what are the advantage and disadvantages?
question_answer:
The controversial topic with respect to emigration never fails to attract public attention. There has been a heated debate on whether the advantages of immigrating into a foreign country outweigh its disadvantages. As far as I am concerned, I tend to be the advocate regarding this issue. 

It is evidently reasonable for me to believe that relocating to a new country is favourable to ones development due to the fact that such an experience contributes to an expansion of knowledge. This is because, with travel, comes the power of knowledge and learning. To be more specific, travelling to new cities and countries allows one to gain a penetrating insight into different cultures, languages, and histories, which helps individuals to become more open-minded and tolerant. To illustrate this, increased tolerance towards multi-cultural societies is a convincing example. As a result, social harmony has improved. 

In contrast, it is commonly believed as a fact that culture shock may be triggered by the differences in living situations, food, transportation and social mannerisms.  However, this argument does not hold water. It should be pointed out that migrating to a foreign country usually accompanies personal growth. That is to say, when a person moves to a new state, he or she will be thrown into brand new situations and settings that may seem intimidating and scary at first, but challenges are always the best ways to grow for an individual because those challenges impel immigrants to improve their physical and emotional skills continually. 

In a nutshell, due to the mentioned reasons, we may safely reach the conclusion that moving to a new country comes with more advantages. Despite the fact that it may cause culture shock, people migrating to a foreign country have a broader horizon and a chance to achieve self-growth.

The controversial topic with respect to university courses never fails to attract public attention. There has been a heated debate on whether popular culture courses are a valid subject in universities. As far as I am concerned, I tend to be the advocate regarding this issue.

It is evidently reasonable for me to believe that these courses are of vital importance due to the fact that students need a global awareness and understanding of other cultures. This is because such an approach helps students to gain interesting insights about how and why people behave so differently in different cultures. Better yet, the knowledge you gain has very practical application in business and other fields today. To illustrate this, pop music is a convincing example. As a result, with a broadened horizon, those open-minded students tend to gain improved employability by popular culture courses. 

In contrast, it is commonly believed as a fact that paying more attention to academic performance is required and traditional courses should be seen as the first priority. Nevertheless, this argument does not hold water. It should be pointed out that popular culture courses are able to enrich the curriculum and boost learning interest and passion. That is to say, students tend to develop various interests and hobbies in order to achieve all-round development. Since these courses create greater curiosity, they can effectively improve students practical skills as well.

question_text: Should parents be held legally responsible for the actions of their children? Do you agree with this opinion? Support your position with your own study, experience or observations.
question_answer:
The controversial topic with respect to whether parents should be held legally responsible for the actions of their children never fails to attract public attention. While some people think that parents should be accountable for their kids, others hold the view that this is not sustainable in the long-term. In my opinion, I think that parents are legally responsible for their children, but only up to a certain age. 

First and foremost, it is evidently reasonable for one to think that parents are liable for their childrens actions, on account of their direct influence. To be more specific, young children depend on their parents for guidance in distinguishing right from wrong, as they are yet to establish their own mature judgment. For example, a recent article published in The Age states, 90% of illegal acts committed by young children were found to be unintentional, and were mainly a result of a lack of supervision by parents. It is thus clearly shown that parents should be held legally accountable for their childrens misconduct. 

However, this is only valid up to a certain age. This is because as children mature, they develop the ability to reflect and evaluate the consequences of their own actions. For instance, according to a recent study conducted by the University of Melbourne, young adults who committed unlawful acts were aware that their actions were wrong and could warrant punishments by the law, but still chose to go ahead. Without a doubt, this demonstrates that the legal consequences of their actions should then fall upon them to take on, rather than their parents. 

In a nutshell, for the aforementioned reasons, I wholeheartedly endorse that parents should be held legally responsible for the actions of their children, but in fairness, only for those of younger ages.

question_title: Bickering led to high divorce rate
question_text: The bickering has become a common trend amongst youngsters and married people, which led to polygamy and high divorce rate. Discuss the positive and negative effects.
question_answer:
In the modern society, bickering between couples has led to polygamy and high divorce rate. In this essay, I am going to investigate the positive and negative effects about it. 

It is evidently reasonable for some to believe that such a trend tends to have negative effects on children. The first point with respect to this is that if parents get divorced, children are then forced to live with one of them. To be more specific, while the single parent has to juggle both jobs as well as domestic duties, children seldom receive attention for their healthy growth. Moreover, permanent absence of one parent would create serious psychological problems for the young generations. To illustrate this, children with aggressive behaviour is a convincing example. As a result, children of divorced parents suffer from stress, anxiety and depression in their childhood.

In contrast, it is commonly believed as a fact that people will be happier if divorced than if they stay unhappily married. Nevertheless, this argument does not hold water. It should be pointed out that divorce impacts economic opportunities. That is to say, when couples are divorced, more housing, power and resources are required. Apart from that, after getting divorced, productivity and wage gains in men decrease, compared to women who tend to apply for welfare benefits because of a disrupted marriage.

In a nutshell, I think that the above-mentioned problem can be solved one day in the future. Additionally, I would suggest that it seems highly wise and vital for parents to avoid bickering by striking smooth communication in their marriages.

question_text: A healthy body is more reliant on healthy dietary habit than exercise, to what extent do you agree or disagree?
question_answer:
The controversial topic with respect to health care never fails to attract public attention. There has been a heated debate on whether healthy body is more reliant on healthy dietary habit than exercise. As far as I am concerned, I tend to be the advocate regarding this issue.

It is evidently reasonable for me to believe that maintaining a healthy diet is more important due to the fact that it promotes optimal body weight and can assist in disease prevention. This is because compared with exercise, taking in the same number of calories as you burn tends to be more effective to maintain steady body weight. To illustrate this, individuals who enjoy longevity is a convincing example. As a result, ensuring a healthy dietary habit can be seen as a reliable approach to avoid health problems. 

In contrast, it is commonly believed as a fact that exercise helps you control and manage your weight by burning calories. Nevertheless, this argument does not hold water. It should be pointed out that a well-balanced diet can help you get the calories and nutrients you need to fuel your daily activities. That is to say, the vitamins and minerals you take in from your diet function throughout the body in support of your bodys processes.

In a nutshell, due to the mentioned reasons, we may safely reach the conclusion that an adoption of a healthy dietary habit gives greater benefits to human body. Despite the fact that exercise remains a viable option, it cant provide the necessary nutrients as our bodies need.

question_text: Do you think the information era has made us lazier, or it is an efficient way or us to gain information?
question_answer:
The controversial topic with respect to information technology never fails to attract public attention. There has been a heated debate on whether information era has a positive effect on us. As far as I am concerned, I tend to be the advocate regarding this issue.

It is evidently reasonable for me to believe that this cutting-edge technology is beneficial to us due to the fact that it vastly increases the knowledge at our fingertips and expands our understanding of the world. This is because modern information technology provides an instant update of news and a large variety of consumer goods from online websites with no geographical barriers. To illustrate this, Facebook is a convincing example. As a result, our horizon is broadened accordingly. 

In contrast, it is commonly believed as a fact that technology makes us weaker socially, physically and mentally. Nevertheless, this argument does not hold water. It should be pointed out that the development of communication technology helps us to keep in touch with friends and families, which leads to better social lives. That is to say, we now have instant access to our friends and family members a few miles away. Unlike traditional telephones, cell phones have brought this communication power into our hands even when we are in the most remote locations.

In a nutshell, due to the mentioned reasons, we may safely reach the conclusion that information era has its advantages over its disadvantages. Despite the fact that it allows us to remain sedentary for longer periods of time, it still plays an important role in our social lives.

question_text: Do you think we should pay for online content or they should be free?
question_answer:
The topic with respect to the Internet never fails to attract public attention. There has been a heated debate on whether Internet users should pay for online content or the content should be free. As far as I am concerned, I tend to be the advocate of the former suggestion.

It is evidently reasonable for me to believe that online content should not be free due to the fact with this money, the Internet will be enriched with more and better content. This is because content designers and producers can benefit from their creativity and efforts they made. Take journalism as an example. Many great journalists have lost jobs and many renowned newspapers have closed down due to the poor profit in this business. As a result, making users pay for the online content can help the realization of healthier and sustainable development of the Internet. 

In contrast, it is commonly believed as a fact that such content should be free because profitable business models can be built on free content. Nevertheless, this argument does not hold water. It should be pointed out that intellectual property rights must be honored. That is to say, respecting IPR reflects the progress of mankind and also protects the IPR owners legal rights and benefits. 

In a nutshell, due to the above-mentioned reasons, we may safely reach the conclusion that the users should pay for what they enjoy online. Despite the fact that this can make some users unhappy, we can gain a more balanced development for the Internet.

question_translate.text_translate: [{"src":"Do you think we should pay for online content or they should be free?","dst":"你认为我们应该为在线内容付费还是免费？"}]

question_text: A government should not be responsible for the investment on arts such as painting and music should devote to the practice areas, do you agree or disagree?
question_answer:
The topic with respect to arts never fails to attract public attention. There has been a heated debate on whether a government should not be responsible for investing in arts such as painting and music but be responsible for investing in practical areas. As far as I am concerned, I tend to be the opponent regarding this issue. 

It is evidently reasonable for me to believe that the government has the duty to invest in arts due to the fact that arts can enrich peoples cultural life. This is because artistic works can provide various entertainments for the general public. For example, artistic forms like music, painting and opera are very popular among people in almost every community.  Also, arts are also the symbols of each country for displaying and preserving the vital heritage of the existing traditions and cultures. As a result, arts are indispensable for both an individual and a society, which requires the governments investment.

In contrast, it is commonly believed as a fact that the governments investment should be focused on strengthening the infrastructure and public services. Nevertheless, this argument does not hold water. It should be pointed out that arts are also beneficial for economic reasons. That is to say, some artistic outputs have contributed heavily to the economic growth of a country. Movies, music or theater have increased the tax revenue for the government.

In a nutshell, due to the above-mentioned reasons, we may safely reach the conclusion that a government has the responsibility for investing in artistic areas. Despite the fact that such investment may not fuel economic growth directly, it can have a broader significance for the whole society.

question_text: Teenagers should accept lessons about principles of personal finance, such as spend wisely or loan risk, to what extent do you agree or disagree?
question_answer:
The topic with respect to teenagers education never fails to attract public attention. There has been a heated debate on whether they should accept lessons about principles of personal finance. As far as I am concerned, I tend to be the advocate regarding this issue.

It is evidently reasonable for me to believe that these courses are significant for young people due to the fact that they can appreciate the value of money. This is because, through these lessons such as how to spend wisely or loan risk, they can learn where it comes from, how it can be spent and more importantly, the value that it has in the life of their family. For example, a child who saves up for his own Play Station will understand the value of money and appreciate it more. As a result, the ultimate goal of such lessons is that teenagers can develop the important meaning and use of saving. 

In contrast, it is commonly believed as a fact that dealing with money too early makes the young materialistic. Nevertheless, this argument does not hold water. It should be pointed out that teaching kids about money improve the decision-making ability and it is also a great way to foster a responsible attitude in them. That is to say, when they have to consider the consequences of their actions in terms of money, this process develops their decision-making skills and the sense of responsibility to face the consequences. 

In a nutshell, due to the mentioned reasons, we may safely reach the conclusion that exposing students to lessons about personal finances could be a desirable option. Despite the fact that this can lead to money worship, they can gain more from such lessons.

question_text: How does the design of building affect, either positively or negatively, where people work and live?
question_answer:
The controversial topic with respect to the design of buildings never fails to attract public attention. While some people think that the design of a building affects peoples work and life positively, on the other end of the spectrum, others hold the opposite view. In my opinion, I strongly believe that the design has more advantages than disadvantages due to environmental friendliness and working efficiency.

First and foremost, it is evidently reasonable for one to think that the design of buildings is essential on account of its positive impacts on the environment. Although the potential negative impacts of fully covered buildings, such as the lack of natural lighting and ventilation, should be taken into consideration, I still maintain that a well-designed building helps to reduce the energy consumptions and greenhouse gas emissions. For example, a recent article published in The Economist states, 70% of buildings in Europe are now equipped with solar panels, which can save up to 7 million tonnes of carbon emissions each year. Thus, it is clearly shown that these eco-friendly buildings could help to save the environment.

Furthermore, the working efficiency and effectiveness also add weight to my argument. This is because the design of buildings often includes the consideration of features such as daylight, connection to nature, and spaces for social interaction, which will boost work performance and productivity. For instance, according to a recent study conducted by the University of Melbourne, 90% of employees in developed countries feel more motivated to work in a well-designed office. Without a doubt, it is clearly shown that the design of buildings plays a major role in improving working efficiency. 

In a nutshell, for the aforementioned environmental friendliness and working efficiency, I wholeheartedly endorse that the design of buildings has positive impacts on peoples life and work.

The design of buildings has positive impacts on people’s safety.

question_text: The time people devote to their job leaves very little time for personal life. How widespread is this problem? What problem will this shortage of time cause?
question_answer:
The controversial topic with respect to work-life balance never fails to attract public attention. While some people think that the problem that people devote more time to jobs is widespread, others hold the opposite view. In my opinion, I strongly agree that work-life conflict is a widespread and serious problem that impacts workers, their employers and communities.

First and foremost, it is evidently reasonable for one to think that the problem spreads widely especially among young people on account of fierce competition. To be specific, many young workers are trying to survive and be successful, and this forces them to spend more than eight hours per day at work. For example, a recent article published in The Economist states, 90% of employees in China suffer under long hours in office, pressure from managers and project deadlines created by clients, which results in their personal lives becoming ignored. Thus, work-life balance is a major problem due to the competitive environment.

Furthermore, the problems caused by long work hours cannot be ignored. This is because working overtime means less free time to spend with family members, which can often lead to an unhealthy relationship. For instance, according to a recent study conducted by the University of Melbourne, when married mothers are employed for more hours per week, it adversely affects marital quality by decreasing couples' time together or increasing feelings of role conflict and work overload. Without a doubt, it is clearly shown that more frequent fatigue experienced by those with extra work hours leads to more frequent interference with family members.

In a nutshell, for the aforementioned reasons, I wholeheartedly endorse that despite the fact that we may get properly paid, working overtime is detrimental especially to our health.

It is extremely widespread that people devote more times in jobs and leave very little time for personal life.
-       核心论点1：在年轻人中更为普遍

Many young workers are trying to survive and be successful in the early stage of their career development.

The problem of people devoting more time in jobs is extremely widespread among office jobs.
People work long hours in office because the pressure from managers and project deadlines created by clients, which results in their personal lives being ignored.
-       核心论点3：在竞争激烈的发展中国家更为普遍
The problem that people devote more time in jobs is widespread in developing countries due to the increasing competition in the job market.

-       核心论点1：损害家庭关系
Working overtime means less free time to spend with family members, which can often lead to unhealthy relationships.
It adversely affected marital quality because of the decrease in time spent together with partner or increase in conflicts and workload.
Extra work hours can indirectly strain interactions with family members.
-       核心论点2：损害身体和心理健康
A balance between work and other aspects of life is essential to stay healthy.
Working overtime at workplace could lead to exhaustion, stress, and lifestyle diseases.
-       核心论点3：降低工作效率
Working overtime adversely affect people’s productivity at work.
People with long working hours often get exhausted in tasks and lose concentration at work.

Working overtime often leaves no time for individuals to develop personal interests and leads to decreasing life satisfaction in general.

question_text: Education should teach us ethics and life values that will be practical for future employment. What is your opinion?
question_answer:
The controversial topic with respect to the role of education never fails to attract public attention. There has been a heated debate on whether the education should teach us ethics and life values that will be practical for future employment. As far as I am concerned, I tend to be the advocate regarding this issue.

It is evidently reasonable for me to believe that teaching students about ethics and life values has more advantages than its disadvantages, due to the fact that such an approach would prepare our children for their future roles in the society. This is because the primary goal of the education should be enabling students to gain knowledge and moral values, and our children would need both of them in preparing themselves to be good citizens in the society. As a result, if moral values are taught in schools, we would have fewer problems such as violence and dishonesty in the world.

In contrast, it is commonly believed as a fact that students should spend more time on their academic performance, because math, science, and language courses are far more important. Nevertheless, this argument does not hold water. It should be pointed out that many employers are seeking talents with the high moral standard. That is to say, characters such as honesty and respect are keys to success in workplaces, and the education of ethics and moral would have many positive effects on students future careers. 

In a nutshell, due to the mentioned reasons, we may safely reach the conclusion that the education of ethics and life values has more advantages than its disadvantages. Despite the fact that students academic performances are also important, the lessons of ethics and life values would be beneficial to their future careers in the long term.

question_title: Nurses and doctors get pay more
question_text: Workers like nurses and doctors should be paid more. What is your opinion?
question_answer:
The controversial topic with respect to the nurses and doctors never fails to attract public attention. There has been a heated debate on whether nurses and doctors should be paid more. As far as I am concerned, I tend to be the advocate regarding this issue. 

It is evidently reasonable for me to believe that salaries of nurse and doctors should be higher than others due to the fact that they show more importance to the society compared with other occupations. This is because medical staff directly deals with human life risks and the responsibility involved in treating a patient much higher than other jobs. To illustrate this, for example, doctors and nurses should be very careful with patients who are undergoing critical surgeries. As a result, these healthcare professionals deserve higher salaries for the care they show and the effort they make. 

In contrast, it is commonly believed as a fact that people should get paid according to their productivity and profitability. Nevertheless, this argument does not hold water. It should be pointed out that harder work is often required for doctors and nurses. That is to say, medical personnel are supposed to be abreast with new medicines, medical practices, and the latest treatment methodologies, while at the same time, they would have to overstretch beyond their normal working hours to be present for surgeries.

In a nutshell, due to the mentioned reasons, we may safely reach the conclusion that nurses and doctors should be paid more. Despite the fact that people should get paid according to their productivity and profitability, medical personnel show more importance to the society and work harder than other positions.

question_text: Experience is more effective and useful than books and formal education. What is your opinion? Support your opinion with reasons and/or your personal experience.
question_answer:
The controversial topic with respect to experience never fails to attract public attention. While some people think that experience is more effective and useful than books and formal education, on the other end of the spectrum others hold the opposite view. In my opinion, I strongly believe that experience will bring more benefits due to career development and a powerful network.

First and foremost, it is evidently reasonable for one to think that compared to classroom knowledge, experience has more advantages on account of career development. Although the potential positive impacts of formal education, such as academic knowledge and professional skills, should be taken into consideration, I still maintain that experience could equip students with the soft skills needed to succeed in any organization. For example, a recent article published in The Economist states, 90% of graduates agree that teamworking skills strengthen their competitiveness in future jobs. Thus, it is clearly shown that with useful experience, people could quickly adjust themselves to companies rules and regulations, and this would benefit their careers directly.

Furthermore, the powerful network also adds weight to my argument. This is because people can contact and learn from professionals in their realms. For instance, according to a recent study conducted by the University of Melbourne, 90% of students take advantage of a powerful network for their career promotions, and it also helps them avoid common mistakes of career planning in the future. Without a doubt, it is clearly shown that life experience effectively helps students broaden their social networks.

In a nutshell, for the aforementioned reasons, I wholeheartedly endorse that useful experience is a key factor in students future careers.

question_text: Some people argue that science is more important than arts. What is your opinion?
question_answer:
The controversial topic with respect to science and art never fails to attract public attention. There has been a heated debate on whether science is more important than art. As far as I am concerned, I tend to be the advocate regarding this issue.

It is evidently reasonable for me to believe that science shows more significant values than art due to the fact that it raises our living standards and makes our lives physically better. This is because the development of science leads to inventions in workplaces, which replaces physical labors and boosts our working efficiency and effectiveness. To illustrate this, using the computer to avoid repetitive work is a convincing example. As a result, more time can be left for relaxation and recreational activities, which improves our life quality.

In contrast, it is commonly believed as a fact that art makes us happy and fulfill our emotional needs to some extent. Nevertheless, this argument does not hold water. It should be pointed out that the development of science has shaped this planets infrastructures and would allow the human race to continuously progress. That is to say, people cannot live without science as it provides us with improved food, water, transportations, and cures to diseases.

In a nutshell, due to the mentioned reason, we may safely reach the conclusion that science is more important than art. Despite the fact that art makes us happy, science improves our productivity and allows the human race to continuously progress.

question_text: Is it fair for universities to deduct students marks when their assignments are overdue? How to solve this problem?  OR Some universities deduct students marks for overdue assignments. Give your opinion, and suggest some alternative actions.
question_answer:
The controversial topic with respect to whether universities should deduct marks for overdue assignments never fails to attract public attention. While some people think that a penalty for late assignments can generate positive outcomes, others hold the view that it can be unfair to students. In my opinion, I believe that universities should deduct marks, but alternative actions should also be discussed. 

First and foremost, it is evidently reasonable for one to think that penalising overdue assignments is beneficial, on account of the improvement to time management. Although the potential negative impacts of late penalties, such as added stress, should be taken into consideration, I still maintain that late penalties have tremendously improved students lives in various ways. To be more specific, it forces students to develop their time management skills and sense of punctuality so as to avoid the penalty. For example, a recent article published in The Economist states, 90% of students admitted that their awareness of deadlines and their ability to manage time wisely started during university years when they had to balance assignments and examinations. It is thus clearly shown that deducting marks for late assignments can be beneficial. 

However, alternative actions should also be considered. This is because the penalty can be unfair to students who actually had a valid reason for handing in their assignments late. For instance, according to a recent study conducted by the University of Melbourne, 90% of students could produce a medical certificate or other forms of proof for their late submission. Without a doubt, this demonstrates that universities should consider assessing students situations before deciding their marks. 

In a nutshell, for the aforementioned reasons, I wholeheartedly endorse that universities should deduct marks, but should also make an effort to take up other actions that can help ensure fairness.

Universities should deduct marks for overdue assignments.
-       核心论点1：可以增强学生的时间管理能力
Penalties for late assignments can help students to improve their time management skills.
-       核心论点2：可以培养学生准时意识和截止时间的观念
Deducting marks for overdue assignments helps students cultivate punctuality and awareness of deadlines.

：

Universities should extend the deadline for students who actually had a valid reason for late submission.

Universities could arrange regular workshops to help students to improve their time management skills.

Universities can send reminders to students before the deadline.
