question_text: Is it positive for Students to learn with employment? / In order to study effectively, it requires comfort, peace and time. So it is impossible for a student to combine learning and employment at the same time, because one distracts the other. Is it realistic to combine them at the same time in our life today? Support your opinion with examples.
question_answer:
The controversial topic with respect to the balance between study and work never fails to attract public attention. While some people think that it is realistic to combine learning and employment at the same time, on the other end of the spectrum, others hold the opposite view. In my opinion, I strongly believe that working while in college is possible due to a well-organized schedule and stress management skills.

First and foremost, it is evidently reasonable for one to think that working and studying at the same time is realistic on account of a well-planned schedule. Although the potential obstacles of combining study and work, such as distraction and limited time, should be taken into consideration, I still maintain that it can be achieved by clearly marking all school and work deadlines on a calendar. For example, a recent article published in The Economist states, The more detailed a calendar is, the more likely one is to stick to it. Thus, it is clearly shown that an organized calendar can help make completing assignments while catching up on work a reality. 

Furthermore, stress management skill also adds weight to my argument. This is because methods of reducing stress have been proven to help enhance concentration, productivity, and multi-tasking abilities. For instance, according to a recent study conducted by the University of Melbourne, 80% of students who practise yoga or meditation to manage their stress have been able to do well in both work and studies simultaneously. Without a doubt, it is clearly shown that stress-reducing activities will ultimately allow students to work to their best ability.

In a nutshell, for the aforementioned reasons, I wholeheartedly endorse that it is realistic to obtain a job in college. To address this, governments and societies should make efforts to support it.

question_explain.text: It is realistic to combine learning and employment at the same time in our life today

It is realistic to combine learning and employment at the same time in our life today.
-       核心论点1：出色的任务安排
It is realistic to combine learning and employment at the same time if people can create well-planned schedule.
It needs to clearly mark all school and work deadlines on a calendar and figure out priorities and the amount of time to get everything done.
The more detailed a calendar is, the more likely to stick to it.
-       核心论点2：雇主提供一些学习支持
It is realistic to combine learning and employment at the same time if employer could provide continuous learning at work.
Those supports include paid study leave, mentor program, on-job training.
-       核心论点3：加强自身压力管理
It is realistic to combine learning and employment at the same time if students have good stress management skills.
Reducing stress is important for staying focused, centred and productive.
Student services are available in many education institutions for students who are struggling with managing stress.

It is unrealistic to combine learning and employment at the same time in our life today.
-       核心论点1：学习和工作会互相影响
It is unrealistic to combine learning and employment at the same time because work will distract students from studying and result in poor academic performance.
People with employment often get exhausted in working tasks and lose concentration in study after work.
-       核心论点2：学习和工作都需要大量时间
It is unrealistic to combine learning and employment at the same time because work and study both take a lot of time.
People often find it hard to manage tasks and deadlines between work and study.
-       核心论点3：对健康是重大的挑战
It is unrealistic to combine learning and employment at the same time because it could lead to physical and mental illness.
Lack of sleep, skip meals and stress often cause health and wellbeing issues.

question_title: Better public transport vs more roads
question_text: As cities expanding, some people claim governments should look forward creating better networks of public transportation available for everyone rather than building more roads for vehicle owning population. Whats your opinion? Give some examples or experience to support.
question_answer:
The controversial topic with respect to transportation never fails to attract public attention. While some people think that public transport is more vital, on the other end of the spectrum, others hold the view that governments should concentrate on building more roads. In my opinion, I strongly believe that public transportation brings more benefits due to environmental friendliness and financial reasons.

First and foremost, it is evidently reasonable for one to think that it is more essential to develop an adequate transport network on account of environmental friendliness. Although the potential positive impacts of constructing more roads, such as urbanization and increased employment rate, should be taken into consideration, I still maintain that an efficient public transport network will significantly reduce private car usage, which would critically lower the emission of greenhouse gases. For example, a recent article published in The Economist states, Carbon dioxide emission from private vehicles is the major reason contributing to global warming. Thus, it is clearly shown that a better travel network would promote sustainable development in the long-term.

Furthermore, the financial reason also adds weight to my argument. This is because public transport is more cost-effective than private vehicles. For instance, according to a recent study conducted by the University of Melbourne, people who to travel work via public transport spend 45% less on commuting each year than those who drive in to work. Without a doubt, it is clearly shown that public transport is more affordable for the general population.

In a nutshell, for the aforementioned reasons, I wholeheartedly endorse that it is effective and eco-friendly to put more efforts into developing local transport infrastructure.

question_explain.text: Governments should create better networks of public transportation rather than build more roads.
观点1：改善公共交通 Improve public transport

Governments should look towards creating better networks of public transportation available for everyone rather than building more roads for car owners.
 A better travel network would promote sustainable development in the long-term.
 -        核心论点1：公共交通是城市中最经济的出行方式
 Public transport is the most economical way of commuting in cities.
 People who travel to work via public transport spend 45% less on commuting each year than those who drive to work.
 Public transport is more affordable for the general population.
 -        核心论点2：减少私人车辆，更加环保
 It is more essential to develop an adequate transport network on account of environmental friendliness.
 An efficient public transport network will significantly reduce private car usage, which would critically lower the emission of greenhouse gases.
 Carbon dioxide, a major pollutant produced by private vehicles, is the major reason contributing to global warming.
 -        核心论点3：减少道路拥堵，节约通勤时间
 Better public transport networks can help reduce traffic congestions, which can help people save commuting time.
 As cities expand, daily commuting time for workers has increased dramatically, which makes it necessary for the government to create more public trasport networks to reduce the time spent on the road.
观点2：修建更多道路 Build more roads

Governments should look towards building more roads for car owners rather than creating better networks of public transportation available for everyone.
 -        核心论点1：带动当地发展（要想富先修路）
 It is essential to build more roads in order to boost local development.
 Roads can connect cities together and narrow the gap between urban and rural areas.
 -        核心论点2：增加就业率
 Building more roads can effectively boost the economy and creates more job opportunities.
 Infrastructure construction projects like road construction can create tens of thousands job opportunities. 
 -        核心论点3：节省出行时间
 More roads means less traffic congestions on the road, which help people save large amounts of commuting time for more important things.
 As cities expand, daily commuting time for workers has increase dramatically.

question_text: Discuss the significance of music to the study of young children. Certain kinds of music can promote young children learning, do you agree or disagree?
question_answer:
The controversial topic with respect to music never fails to attract public attention. There has been a heated debate on whether music is of great importance. As far as I am concerned, I tend to be the advocate regarding this issue.

It is evidently reasonable for me to believe that music is more than significant due to the fact that it helps children to develop their well-rounded skills and enhance their study performances. This is because the ability to deeply appreciate music has usually been linked to creativity, imagination and intellectual curiosity, all of which contribute significantly to childrens academic excellence, as well as comprehensive development. 

To illustrate this, it is a convincing example that many top students have developed their interest in music at a very young age. As a result, they will gain crucial practical skills, instead of focusing purely on academic scores. 

In contrast, it is commonly believed as a fact that listening to music while studying can be distractive. Nevertheless, this argument does not hold water. It should be pointed out that if properly chosen, certain types of music can help release pressure, thus enhancing learning efficiency. That is to say, children can be soothed and motivated by gentle and relaxing music, improving their efficiency and capabilities of coping with stressful situations.

In a nutshell, due to the mentioned reasons, we may safely reach the conclusion that listening to music is beneficial and crucial. Despite the fact that it can be distractive, it would solidly promote students well-rounded development and inspire them to learn.

question_translate.text_translate: [{"src":"Discuss the significance of music to the study of young children.","dst":"讨论音乐对幼儿学习的意义。"},{"src":"Certain kinds of music can promote young children learning, do you agree or disagree?","dst":"某些音乐可以促进幼儿学习，你同意还是不同意？"}]

question_title: Doctor look at patients via internet
question_text: Doctor and internet-based communication allow doctors to look at patients. Is this new development has more advantages or disadvantages?
question_answer:
The controversial topic with respect to medical advancements never fails to attract public attention. There has been a heated debate on whether the remote diagnosis is more advantageous than disadvantageous. As far as I am concerned, I tend to be the advocate regarding this issue.

It is evidently reasonable for me to believe that such an approach is beneficial due to the fact that online communication between doctors and patients could reduce medical costs and increase diagnostic efficiency. This is because this new technology enables the real-time monitoring of patient as well as timely responses from doctors, thus significantly cutting down the time of treatment process. As patients are not required to visit the hospital on a regular basis, medical services become more time-saving and cost-effective. To illustrate this, online diagnosis is a convincing example. As a result, the whole medical system would operate more efficiently, which could also enhance patients experience, improving peoples living standard considerably. 

In contrast, it is commonly believed as a fact that such practice may raise the issues of patients privacy security and data accuracy. Nevertheless, this argument does not hold water. It should be pointed out that such an advancement would hugely raise the outcomes of treatment. That is to say, through this technology, physicians are able to build a database, which enables them to work systematically. Moreover, they can also access real-time information and make informed decisions, all of which contribute largely to improving medical service quality.

In a nutshell, due to the mentioned reasons, we may safely reach the conclusion that the remote diagnosis is helpful. Despite the fact that it may give rise to security and accuracy concerns, it would decrease medical spending and improve treatment outcome, as well as diagnostic efficiency.

question_text: Some people point that experiential learning (i.e. learning by doing it) can work well in formal education. However, others think a traditional form of teaching is the best. Do you think experiential learning is beneficial in high schools or colleges?
question_answer:
The controversial topic with respect to whether experiential learning can work well in formal education never fails to attract public attention. While some people think that it can be beneficial in high schools and colleges, on the other end of the spectrums, others believe that traditional forms of teaching are still the best. In my opinion, I tend to be an advocate of experiential learning, due to the following reasons. 

First and foremost, it is evidently reasonable for one to think that experiential learning enhances school education on account of the reinforcement factor. Although the potential positive impacts of more traditional forms of education, such as time-efficiency, should be taken into consideration, I still maintain that hands-on learning has tremendously increased students performance in various ways. To be more specific, applying theories to practice allows students to deepen their grasp of academic concepts, and accelerate their learning. For example, a recent article published in The Economist states, Students who conducted science experiments in school performed 80% better in formal examinations than those who only learnt the theories. It is thus clearly shown that experiential learning can reinforce knowledge learnt.

Furthermore, the motivation factor also adds weight to my argument. This is because different types of experiential learning, such as building models, making films, going on camps and fieldtrips, are more exciting and engaging for students, which increases their learning interest. For instance, according to a recent study conducted by the University of Melbourne, colleges that ran fieldtrips had a higher attendance rate for all their classes. Without a doubt, this demonstrates that learning outside a traditional academic setting increases student motivation. 

In a nutshell, for the aforementioned reasons, I wholeheartedly endorse that experiential learning brings significant benefits, and schools should support and incorporate such learning methods in their curriculum.

 Experiential learning reinforces knowledge learnt.
 -       核心论点2：在实践中使用理论知识加速和深化学生的学习和理解
 Applying theories to practice allows students to deepen their grasp of academic concepts, and accelerate their learning.

 Experiential learning can make learning easy and fun, which increases student motivation.

Experiential learning is problematic in high schools or colleges/ Traditional form of teaching is the best

 Experiential learning can be time-consuming and will decrease learning efficiency.
 -       核心论点2：会加大学习经济成本
 Experiential learning may increase financial cost of learning knowledge.

question_text: Whether studying films at school is as important as studying literature? Do you think school should have curriculum asking students to play old drama and work for theatre centuries ago?
question_answer:
The controversial topic with respect to education never fails to attract public attention. There has been a heated debate on whether studying films at school is as important as studying literature. As far as I am concerned, I tend to be the advocate regarding this issue.

It is evidently reasonable for me to believe that film study plays as important a role as studying literature due to the fact that this approach of education is easier for students especially those young ones to engage and digest. This is because comparing to literature, it is easier for students to understand the content of films, on the other hand, with the straight-forward and entertaining traits, films are more likely to spark students motivation and interest to study the subject. To illustrate this, Disney movies are a convincing example. As a result, films are embedded in the curriculum, and film studies are considered as viable an option for pupils as music and art.

In contrast, it is commonly believed as a fact that students should spend more time on literature studying for it stands for the merit of historical heritage. Nevertheless, this argument does not hold water. It should be pointed out that the studying of these contemporary arts including films helps to boost students confidence. That is to say, films, along with other performing arts in this day and age, helps young people to think outside the box and be more confident thus students would believe themselves about their ideas and abilities.

In a nutshell, due to the mentioned reasons, we may safely reach the conclusion that films are an indispensable part of our education. Despite the fact that the studying of literacy boosts students academic performance, the merits of films should never be overlooked.

question_text: Some people think placing advertisements in schools is a great resource for public schools that need additionally funding, but others think it exploits children by treating them as a captive audience for corporate sponsors. Choose which position you most agree with and discuss why you chose that position. Support your point of view with details from your own experiences, observations or reading.
question_answer:
It is believed that advertisement is a prime source of a business which contributes to generate a large amount of fund for any organization or corporation like schools. However, some argue that schools are not an appropriate place to place advertisement in the name of extra fund collection. I will be in favor of the last notion.

To begin with, placing advertisements in schools will distract juveniles who do not have controlling power on themselves as psychological aspect of children needs to be considered before placing an advertisement in school. School children might less concentrate on their studies and more focus on colorful advertisements because of which their future will be uncertain as they will not be able to pass their course easily. For example, a child who is in the habit of involving in various advertising campaigns since childhood, lacks behind on his or her studies. In the same way, young pupils will be obsessed with money and if there is a shortage of money in any stage of their life while growing, they might indulge in an illegal act to achieve money.

On the other side of the fence, there are positive aspect as well, as children may get a good opportunity for future and they can shape their life by following only positive outcomes of advertisement.

To conclude, the latter notion outweighs the first one as students should focus on their studies at this age rather than highlighting in other aspect like advertisement. Therefore, Advertisements should be banned from the schools. We should ensure a good and quiet place for kids to study.

question_text: In the 18th century due to industrialization, a lot of people migrated to developed countries. This affected lifestyle and increased problems in developed countries. What is your opinion about this?
question_answer:
During the 18th century a lot of people migrated to developed countries for better job opportunities, comfortable lifestyle and economic stability, which eventually affected the many areas of developed countries. I agree that this change has a significant effect on developed countries and I would like to share my views on the same.

Firstly, earlier those days, the industrialization had just started. Many people started looking for new opportunities outside their native. As the local opportunities were limited, so people easily got their jobs in better places other than their own countries. This led to inflow of immigrants and subsequently, rise in the population started to begin.

Furthermore, when the immigrants took the developed nations lucrative jobs, the locals were deprived from their right to work within their own countries. This badly hampered the situation. People started to rebel, they became involved in social offences and opted for easy money earning. These not only made the situation worst, but also made the narcotic products popular within the new generations.

To conclude, the 18th century boom in industrialization has hampered both lifestyle and led to the instability of social equilibrium.

question_text: Marketing strategy for big companies should be placed on offer and discounts, and in what ways this can impact on their reputation?
question_answer:
With globalization and rise of industries, the competition to be the best and on the top of the market has also increased. Companies use various methods and strategies to compete with each other. One of these measures is placing offers and discounts on their products. This essay will discuss the influence of this strategy on its reputation.

To begin with, discounts and offers placed on the products increase its sales. Many a times people buy products which are not required only because there is a discount on it. This helps the company to make the consumers aware of their product in the market. When a product is newly introduced in the market, a low price is quoted, so that the buyers give it a preference over the other known items. Once, the buyers are familiar with the product and the sales increase, the discounts are taken off. This is a very lucrative method used by the companies today.

Nevertheless, sometimes these strategies fail. Many times, people doubt the quality of the products with offers. They think that the materials used to make those items are cheap and low quality and hence do not buy it although they are available at a very low cost than the other similar products. Furthermore, people buy these items only till the offers exist and once the actual price is quoted, they think it is highly priced and hence avoid buying it. Some consumers have a liking towards a particular company product and do not buy items from other companies. This results in loss to those industries which are selling their products with offers and discounts.

To conclude, although offers and discounts increase the sales of the products, companies should also think of its reputation. They should also develop other strategies to attract consumers.

question_translate.text_translate: [{"src":"Marketing strategy for big companies should be placed on offer and discounts, and in what ways this can impact on their reputation?","dst":"大公司的营销策略应该放在报价和折扣上，这会以什么方式影响他们的声誉？"}]

question_text: If voting is compulsory in democratic society, what conclusions can we draw about Nature of democracy?
question_answer:
Compulsory voting in a democratic society is undeniably a controversial topic as it raises a question: how democratic a nation will be with or without compulsory voting. This system has many benefits to the nation if it is implemented in a right manner. In this essay, we will discuss the nature of democracy with few examples of compulsory voting.

Democracy is also known as a Republic, is a governing system where the citizens of the country vote to one of the several parties competing for the Presidents position. If only 30% of the people vote then the outcome of the election will be unfair, as those who did not vote may not like the party that won the election. For instance, In America, Bill Clinton won when mere 34% of the total population voted. Similarly, in India on an average, only 50 to 55% of the people vote and rest have to accept the rules drafted by the unwanted members of the parliament.

Turning to the compulsory casting of the vote, in Australia casting vote is compulsory since last 80 years. Almost 90% of the public participates and there is a little fine for those who dont participate. Moreover, in South American nations like Peru and Bolivia, there is harsh punitive action against those who dont vote. For example, Non-Voters are barred from accessing their own bank accounts for up to 3 months. This is the reason there are some people who are against compulsory voting.

In a nutshell it can be said that compulsory casting of a vote is an imperative step in a democratic society, however, its implication in a friendly manner is of vital importance. So compulsory voting is mandatory for a democracy to be a democracy.

question_translate.text_translate: [{"src":"If voting is compulsory in democratic society, what conclusions can we draw about Nature of democracy?","dst":"如果投票在民主社会是强制性的，那么我们可以对民主的性质得出什么结论呢？"}]

question_text: Some people think that a sense of competition in children should be encouraged. Others believe that children who are taught to co-operate rather than compete become more useful adults. Discuss both these views and give your own opinion.
question_answer:
There is too much debate about whether children should be learned to be more competitive or cooperative members of society. In my opinion, both behaviors are important and cooperation is more important than competition.

On one hand, as we live in the very competitive society, we need to teach our children the sense of competition in a positive way. The most obvious advantage to encourage competition among children is that it makes them more creative and open minded and opens the doors for better future opportunities for them. For illustration, children work hard in the study because they compete with other classmates to receive high marks, this will help them to get a very good job in the future. Moreover, they become more independent and rely on themselves because they know that nobody else will be there to do their duties.

On the other hand, I believe that cooperation is mandatory to be encouraged for many reasons. Firstly, cooperation helps children to learn from each other. For example, when I was at school team, I learned how to play table  tennis  with  my friends and we learn a lot  of skills from each other and when we play in the final round with other school teams,  we get a very good score in the final. Secondly, cooperation teaches children the skills linked to sharing, as a result, they become a kind member of society. Finally, cooperation is the key component for better personality as well as prevent from individuality.

To sum up, both cooperation and competition have their own advantages. However, I tend to think that cooperation should be encouraged more in children.

question_translate.text_translate: [{"src":"Some people think that a sense of competition in children should be encouraged.","dst":"有些人认为应该鼓励孩子们的竞争意识。"},{"src":"Others believe that children who are taught to co-operate rather than compete become more useful adults.","dst":"另一些人认为，那些被教导合作而不是竞争的孩子会成为更有用的成年人。"},{"src":"Discuss both these views and give your own opinion.","dst":"讨论这两种观点并给出自己的观点。"}]

question_text: Some people think that we do not need to print papers newspapers anymore. Do you agree or disagree?
question_answer:
There are different perspectives about printing papers, newspapers. However, the printing ways to provide the news cannot cope with the fast changing society and the development of technologies makes it easier for people to acquire information. Therefore, I completely agree that there will be no need for printing newspapers.

Newspapers would not need to be printed, because people are surrounded by information and easily shared within their societal group. They can easily update and share information with each other and can enhance their relationships. For example, people are associated with at least one societal group such as a school or a work. From there, people can easily share the latest news each other and can develop the communication.

By the time, newspapers being printed and published, the news become outdated and the information may irrelevant. Since we are living in a fast-moving society and the newspapers and news should be changed at rapidity. In the case of US election, for instance, all the other technologies have kept updating with the process of elections whereas the newspapers only published with the final result. Therefore, publishing papers cannot follow with the speed of society changes.

Printed papers, newspapers would disappear because people use alternative forms to acquire information. It is a fact that, a majority of the people already acquire information through TV, internet or mobile phones for its convenience. Lets take an example for my house, my grandmother acquired news from TV, my parents received the news from internet and I heard about the latest news through mobile phones. Therefore, people have changed the ways to acquire information overtime.

In conclusion, the weakness of printed newspapers cannot overtake the strengths of modern technologies and societal group. Therefore, the demand for printing would be reduced.

question_translate.text_translate: [{"src":"Some people think that we do not need to print papers newspapers anymore.","dst":"有些人认为我们不再需要印刷报纸了。"},{"src":"Do you agree or disagree?","dst":"你同意还是不同意？"}]

question_text: Most high-level jobs are done by men. Should governments encourage that a certain percentage of these jobs be reserved to women? What is your opinion?
question_answer:
The rapid industrialization throughout the 21st century resulted in the startup of multinational companies across the globe. The statistics reported by the Financial Times in September 2015 claims that 90 percent of the top-level positions are occupied by men on an average across all companies.  Although, I believe that women must be prepared to take over higher positions, I refute that some proportion of top level jobs to be reserved for women.

Firstly, a company can expect a catastrophic failure in if any top-level decision goes astray, especially if the decision involves multi-billion dollars. For instance, a big finance firm named ABC based in Germany went bankrupt in the second quarter of 2014 due to a wrong decision by its president, who was promoted to the top position based on reservation. Moreover, the board of directors need to scrutinize the top posts with extreme care based on his or her merits, irrespective of gender. Therefore, it is obvious that the top positions should not fall under the reservation policy.

Secondly, ignoring an efficient person to fill in a new position leads to discrimination and engenders the lack of motivation among the employees. For example, if a person is simply promoted to the top post, leaving behind the capable colleagues, there are high chances that the colleagues, who think the decision is not fair, will not work efficiently to their caliber. As a result, it is the organization which loses the productivity. Thus, the top positions should never be reserved based on gender or any category

In conclusion, by analyzing how reservation can lead to poor decision making as well as decrease productivity, reservation should not be in place for top posts. Governments should ensure that they give enough focus to empower women and head positions should be filled in based on merit irrespective of anything.

question_translate.text_translate: [{"src":"Most high-level jobs are done by men.","dst":"大多数高级工作都是由男人做的。"},{"src":"Should governments encourage that a certain percentage of these jobs be reserved to women?","dst":"政府是否应该鼓励妇女保留一定比例的工作？"},{"src":"What is your opinion?","dst":"你的意见是什么？"}]

question_text: Does the advent of internet change the role of teacher? To what extent do you agree?
question_answer:
There is no doubt that with the advent of computers, the education system and the learning procedure have seen some major changes. Gone are the days of searching through books and making notes on a notebook, we are in an era where every information is just a click away. However, in my opinion, the role of teachers in a student's life cannot be overshadowed by any technology; it might change but not disappear completely.

Nobody can argue that computers have made learning more interactive, fun and easy. The mere activity of touching and exploring this device constitutes an enjoyable task for a kid. This accompanied with a relaxing environment, interactive software, usually conduce to better grasping of knowledge. For instance, a student learning or cramming the functioning of heart and referring to the 2D diagrams is less likely to remember a concept than a student who is watching exactly what is happening through videos.

Furthermore, at higher educational level; the online resources such as open universities offering free courses, provide them with an ever accessible source of information, that otherwise would not be at hand.

But, besides the great advantages software offers, the need of human interaction will always be present, at least in the foreseeable future. There is a necessity for a human being to be able to determine what the specifics needs of each individual are. The expertise of a teacher in how to explain and adapt complex concepts to different individuals can hardly be mimicked by a computer, no matter how sophisticated its software is.

To summarize, in my opinion, teachers play and will play a very important role in the classroom, especially at the primary level. The only thing possible is to change how teachers interact, replacing them completely can dampen the education system, no matter how sophisticated the software be.

question_translate.text_translate: [{"src":"Does the advent of internet change the role of teacher?","dst":"互联网的出现是否改变了教师的角色？"},{"src":"To what extent do you agree?","dst":"你在多大程度上同意？"}]

question_text: In the education system, assessment through written formal examinations is still valid or not? /  Formal written examinations can be a valid method to assess students learning. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
question_answer:
The controversial topic with respect to whether formal written examinations can be a valid method to assess students learning never fails to attract public attention. While some people think that written exams are still an effective and efficient way of testing students, on the other end of the spectrum, others hold the view that these tests cannot accurately measure students abilities. In my opinion, I believe that written examinations are valid to an extent, but they also have limitations. 

First and foremost, it is evidently reasonable for one to think that written examinations are still effective in assessing student performance, on account of the importance of theoretical foundations. To be more specific, written examinations can assess students retention of concepts and information taught in classes, which are the fundamental blocks for further learning. For example, a recent article published in The Economist states, Students who achieved over 85% in mathematics written exams during their younger year levels, were more successful in tackling tougher math problems in their older year levels. Thus, it is clearly shown that written examinations can still be a strong gauge of students abilities. 

However, the limited nature of this assessment method cannot be ignored. This is because written examinations cannot evaluate students grasp of skills in practical scenarios. For instance, according to a study conducted by HKU, achieving high scores in the written section of language examinations does not indicate whether a student can use the language in real-life and hold day-to-day conversations. Without a doubt, it is clearly demonstrated that written assessments may not be an entirely valid way of evaluating the various aspects of students learning.

In a nutshell, for the aforementioned reasons, I wholeheartedly endorse that written examinations are a valid indicator of students learning levels to a certain extent.

question_text: Company top-level authorities should or should not take employees suggestions or ideas to take any decisions. Discuss.
question_answer:
Decision making not only requires collection of facts and data, it demands a real experience of the situation and empathetic approaches; it is only feasible if employees are involved in decision making process because being a part of organization they have more reliable data on workforce issues.

Organization is a group of people who direct their actions towards attainment of a common goal; therefore, middle and low-level employees can provide more efficient solutions or decisions which will enhance productivity because higher level people generally have less penetrating data on actual alternatives out of which a best can be selected in decision making process effectively by the employees.

Most of the time employees feel left behind and compelled by the decisions imposed by the higher authorities on them and sometimes that decision is not even practical which leads to wastage of resources. For instance, during my clinical practice as a nurse, our manager initiated half hourly rounds in patients' room at night which wasted nurses valuable time of actual interventions and made patients so restless and sick that hospital stay time increased and brought negative outcomes which could be avoided if nurses could have involved in the decision-making process.

In short, including employees in this process will also motivate them and make them feel significant in the organization which in turn will fortify better mutual relationships and uphill struggle. However, the decision should be made finally by the managers but acquiring employees' opinion will enhance implementation and fruitful outcome of the decision.

question_text: Nowadays TV has become an essential part of life. Medium to spread news and awareness and for some it acts like a companion. What is your opinion about this?
question_answer:
Technology gave us an abundance of devices to utilize; TV is one of them. In my opinion, among its several benefits, news and awareness is of paramount significance as compared to entertaining screenplays. TV really acts like a companion if we use it appropriately to a satisfactory extent.

Television provides us a sophisticated knowledge regarding a variety of topics in a detailed and focused way; several lectures of experts and interviews of accomplished persons stimulate the youngsters in positive way and catalyze the surge of learning something new. But this can only be possible if the channels are selected carefully such as BBC, Nat Geo, and Discovery. Most of the channels are producing misleading shows in a race of profit which affects adolescents in a negative way, these should be neglected.

TV is very beneficial for older people who live alone; in my practice as a nurse, TV is used as a diversional therapy to ease anguish as well as it is a very efficient method to fight with anxiety and depression. This is even useful for those older people who don't have access to internet or can't operate technical devices to surf internet, they can listen to news and other information though TV.

In short, TV can be used in numerous effective ways for educational purposes and to create attentiveness among people related to current issues; misguiding shows should be censored by the government to make it more relevant.

question_text: The mass media including TV, radio and newspaper influence our society and shape our opinions and characters. What is your opinion?
question_answer:
The controversial topic with respect to whether the mass media influences our society and shapes our opinions and characters never fails to attract public attention. While some people think that the mass media does have influence on our society and shape our views, on the other end of the spectrum others hold the view that the mass media has no impact on people. Having always believed that the mass media influences our society and shapes our opinions and characters, I tend to be the advocate regarding this issue due to closer relationships and multifaceted information.

First and foremost, it is evidently reasonable for one to think that the mass media can strengthen social cohesion on account of the closer relationships. Granted that its pivotal to be aware of potentially negative impacts of the mass media, I still maintain that TV, radio and newspaper has tremendously enriched peoples lives in various ways. For example, a renowned American writer Mark Twain once said, Current affairs and global concerns are shared to help develop social cohesion. It is thus clearly shown that the mass media can help strengthen social cohesion.

Furthermore, the multifaceted information also adds weight to my argument. Conventional wisdom has it that ultimately the aim of the mass media is creating information sharing platform. For instance, findings of recent research conducted at the University of Melbourne revealed that 38% of people develop their critical thinking with the help of multifaceted information on the mass media. Without a doubt, this demonstrates that various information on the mass media can help shape our opinions.

In a nutshell, for the aforementioned closer relationships and multifaceted information, I wholeheartedly endorse that the mass media influences our society and shapes our opinions and characters.

question_text: Climate change is a concerning global issue. Who should take on the responsibility for climate change, governments, big companies or individuals?
question_answer:
The controversial topic with respect to the concerning global issue of climate change never fails to attract public attention. While some people think that governments should take responsibility, on the other end of the spectrum, others hold the view that big companies and individuals are also accountable. In my opinion, governments and big companies should take most of the responsibility due to their level of influence and impact in society. 

First and foremost, it is evidently reasonable for one to think that governments should be responsible on account of their societal influence. To be more specific, governments have the power to enact laws and regulations that can help control global warming. For example, a recent article published in The Economist states, Countries that implemented carbon tax policies last year had already seen a 20% decrease in their carbon dioxide emissions. Thus, it is clearly shown that governments should be responsible for mitigating climate change as they have significant power to influence change.  

However, the role of big companies cannot be ignored. This is because large corporations are the major source of greenhouse gas emissions. For instance, according to a recent study conducted by the University of Melbourne, the top 100 manufacturing companies in the world account for 90% of the release of greenhouse gas emissions into the atmosphere through their burning of fossil fuels. Without a doubt, this demonstrates that large corporations should also be held responsible for global warming.

In a nutshell, for the aforementioned reasons, I wholeheartedly endorse that governments and big companies should assume responsibility for the issue of climate change. To address this, they should make a concerted effort to find solutions that can help manage global warming.

question_text: Nowadays, people believe that the environment influences their accomplishments. Some people think their success and accomplishment were influenced by the places where they grew up. Do you think the environment does or does not affect peoples accomplishment and how it affects?
question_answer:
The controversial topic with respect to whether peoples success is influenced by their living environments never fails to attract public attention. While some people think that their success cannot be defined by the place where they grew up, on the other end of the spectrum, others hold the view that their native lands do affect their accomplishments. In my opinion, I strongly believe that peoples achievements should be partly attributed to their living environments because these places can indicate their personality and provide resources necessary for their development.

First and foremost, it is evidently reasonable for one to think that peoples living environments do influence their success due to the different resources these environments can provide. Although the potential positive impacts of personal endeavours should be taken into consideration, I still maintain that living environments have tremendously enriched peoples lives in various ways. For example, a recent article published in The Economist states, 70% of those who come from a rich family and thus have access to better educational resources earn more money than the average person. Thus, it is clearly shown that peoples success can be affected by the resources provided by their living environments.

Furthermore, the geographical identity also adds weight to my argument. This is because people often make assumptions about a person based upon where he or she is from, which can impact a candidates electoral success. For instance, according to a study conducted by HKU, in some countries, over 60% of the presidential candidates cannot get elected because they are born and raised in big cities. Without doubt, it is clearly shown that geography can affect peoples success.

In a nutshell, for the aforementioned resource-related and identity reasons, I wholeheartedly endorse that the environment does affect peoples accomplishments.

question_text: Value added by travel in Education. Is travel a necessary component of education or not? Will scholar sitting at home have more knowledge than one who travels?
question_answer:
The development of society is going towards a globalised world where education is an essential foundation for personal, social and economic success. International studies are becoming a new trend for young people as a way to expand their education beyond their traditional education style. It is agreed that adding a foreign qualification has become an integral part of higher studies. This argument is proven by looking at how it widens people's perspective and helps them with better career opportunities.

Studying abroad helps people increase their awareness about different cultures of the world. This will contribute in creating individuals with a broader understanding of issues concerning today's society rather than limiting them in a scope of home education system. For example, universities have a large community of students both from the local area and all around the globe. The diverse academic community enhances the quality of learning by providing wider spectrum of opinions and expertise. This example clearly shows that international education enhances outlook and sharpens self-awareness. Therefore, we can say that traveling is an important element of education.

Moreover, acquiring a globally recognized qualification or degree opens the doors for international job market. The students gain more knowledge and expertise when abroad and apply them to situations requiring international interactions. Also, employers look for the graduates with international experience either by studying or working abroad. Thus, we can say that international studies add value to a student's education.

In summary, it can be said that travelling to foreign countries for higher studies is a key to succeed in this globalised planet.

question_text: The ownership of cars should be restricted to one per family in order to reduce traffic congestion and pollution. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
question_answer:
It might be true that private automobile owners reflect wealth status of individual. A number of private automobile has soared since a decade ago, yet it has produced traffic congestion and some pollution. Based on that issues, I totally agree if the number of own car per house is limited and I will discuss the reasonable reason in the following paragraphs.

The first, the overwhelming number of private automobile is not synergy with the large of roads. It becomes the primary factor of traffic jam since the roads being overcrowded, which contributing most people spend their time in the road. The capital city of Indonesia, for instance, has occurred increase of traffic congestion annually due to individual car possess. In consequence, traffic jam is able to make late either for students or workers. Indeed, it takes up amount of their energy. Therefore, it is vital to strict the number of car in a house (a car per house) in order to reduce the traffic congestion.

Look at to the other consequence, the high number of car private contributes the amount of pollutions, particularly air pollution. As people know that gas emission from fuel are contain numerous gasses which is dominated by carbon dioxide. Breathing carbon dioxide up is eminent in case human's organ damage. Moreover, pollution is capable of accelerating the humans aging, making people seem like older than the actual age. So, limitation of car owner is the one of ways to make a fall the amount pollution.

To sum up, people are able to save their time effectively in the road if there is no traffic jam anymore, also they can enhance longevity of life. I absolutely agree if the government create the rules about restriction of number of car per home.

question_text: lobal warming Some people think that we should do nothing about global warming. Do you agree or disagree?
question_answer:
Climate change is a major threat to life on Earth, but some people argue that we need to accept it rather than try to stop it. I totally disagree with this opinion, because I believe that we still have time to tackle this issue and reduce the human impact on the Earth's climate.

There are various measures that governments and people could take to prevent climate change. Governments could introduce laws to limit the carbon dioxide emissions that lead to global warming. They could impose green taxes on drivers, airline companies and other polluters, and they could invest in renewable energy production from solar, wind or water power. As individuals, we should also try to limit our contribution to climate change, by becoming more energy efficient, by flying less, and by using bicycles and public transport. 

If instead of taking the above measures we simply try to live with climate change, I believe that the consequences will be disastrous. To give just one example, I am not optimistic that we would be able to cope with even a small rise in sea levels. Millions of people would be displaced by flooding, particularly in countries that do not have the means to safeguard low-lying areas. These people would lose their homes and their jobs, and they would be forced to migrate to nearby cities or perhaps to other countries. 

In conclusion, it is clear to me that we must address the problem of climate change, and I disagree with those who argue that we can find ways to live with it.

question_text: It is argued that getting married before finishing school or getting a job is not a good choice. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
question_answer:
Governments of all the countries around the world has fixed an age above which both males and females can get married. Age of an individual plays a crucial role in marriages. In many societies, children are got married during childhood or even before they start earning. I strongly disagree with this practice.

To begin with, marriage is a huge responsibility, and one should be prepared for all the challenges associated with it. Children going to school are not physically, mentally and emotionally fit to face the difficulties of this relationship. The body of adolescent kids is not prepared for physical intimacy which is an inevitable part of a marriage. This results in early age pregnancies which are life-threatening for the mother as well as the child. These early age marriages have resulted in the rise of premature delivery, stillbirths, death of young mothers during childbirth and anemic mother and child. If this continues of the nation would be dark.

Secondly, there are a lot of financial problems faced by individuals who marry without having a secured job. This has led to poor living quality of the individuals. They are unable to take care of their families which causes depression and frustration. Lack of money and market inflation has led these people into taking illegal measures and hence destroy peace and harmony in society. 

To conclude, I believe that education and financial security makes an individual truly eligible for marriage. These two factors are a necessity to live a healthy and desirable life.

question_text: Information revolution has changed the way of mass communication and had some negative and positive effects on individual lives as well as on society. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
question_answer:
Information revolution has changed our life drastically, as it has made roads to all walks of life. Undoubtedly it has changed the way of mass communication which has its own pros and cons. I agree with this statement that it has negative and positive effect on the person as well as the society because of easily access of information, get expert opinion, less wastage of time and on contrary, misuse of information and spreading rumours.

The first and foremost, due to information revolution of mass media, people can have easy access to information on any topic as it is available just a click away because of internet. Moreover, one can get any expert opinion about the information. Also, getting information fast saves a lot of time because everything is available online. For example, few decades ago we can use the library physically and read books and find any information, but now time has changed now in 21st century, we can access all the books, blogs, and information on our computer or television.

Every coin has two sides, so the information can also be abused. It can mislead people and can cause damage to society. Moreover, people misuse information and that can lead to rumours and even create violence. For instance, information or posts on social media like Face book and Twitter are unsafe as it can create problems in the on the name on religion or anything. Furthermore, wrong elements of society can use information in an inappropriate way like making bombs, guns.

In a nutshell, we can say that society should use the electronic information for the betterment of the society as a whole. If person have any doubt about any information then he should confirm first with Right to Information Act, before taking any action.

question_text: Some people think that human behaviours can be limited and controlled by laws, while others think that laws have little effect. What is your opinion?
question_answer:
The controversial topic with respect to whether laws change human behaviour never fails to attract public attention. While some people think that the law plays an essential role in disciplining peoples behaviour, on the other end of the spectrum, others hold the view that imposing laws on people has little effect unless it is enforced with proper punishments. In my opinion, I strongly disagree with this statement mentioned above because it is the punishments and the law enforcements that secure peoples obedience.

First and foremost, it is evidently reasonable for one to think that people will not obey the law if there is no consequence for their offenses. Although the potential positive impacts of the law itself should be taken into consideration, I still maintain that it is the punishments that have tremendously changed peoples lives in various ways. For example, a recent article published in The Economist states, 80% the people who had been sent to jail once never tried to commit a crime for the second time. Thus, it is clearly shown that a proper penalty system should be established alongside the law.

Furthermore, the presence of the law enforcements also adds weight to my argument. This is because law enforcements like the police can work as an instructor to guide people to abide by the law. For instance, according to a recent study conducted by HKU, no pedestrian tried to jump the red light as usual with the presence of a traffic police officer. Without a doubt, it is clearly shown that it is the law enforcements that urge people to change their behaviour.

In a nutshell, for the aforementioned penalty system and law enforcements, I wholeheartedly endorse that the law can affect peoples behaviour only if it can impose threats to those who offend it.

 Laws have little impact on human behaviours as they are not comprehensive enough to provide sufficient instructions on people’s actions.
 There are margins and grey areas where laws could not provide sufficient guidance on one’s behaviour.

question_text: Marketing strategy for big companies should be placed on offer and discounts, and in what ways this can impact on their reputation?
question_answer:
With globalization and rise of industries, the competition to be the best and on the top of the market has also increased. Companies use various methods and strategies to compete with each other. One of these measures is placing offers and discounts on their products. This essay will discuss the influence of this strategy on its reputation.

To begin with, discounts and offers placed on the products increase its sales. Many a times people buy products which are not required only because there is a discount on it. This helps the company to make the consumers aware of their product in the market. When a product is newly introduced in the market, a low price is quoted, so that the buyers give it a preference over the other known items. Once, the buyers are familiar with the product and the sales increase, the discounts are taken off. This is a very lucrative method used by the companies today.

Nevertheless, sometimes these strategies fail. Many times people doubt the quality of the products with offers. They think that the materials used to make those items are cheap and low quality and hence do not buy it although they are available at a very low cost than the other similar products. Furthermore, people buy these items only till the offers exist and once the actual price is quoted, they think it is highly priced and hence avoid buying it. Some consumers have a liking towards a particular company product and do not buy items from other companies. This results in loss to those industries which are selling their products with offers and discounts.

To conclude, although offers and discounts increase the sales of the products, companies should also think of its reputation. They should also develop other strategies to attract consumers.

question_text: Do you think consumer should avoid over packed products or it is responsibility of producer to avoid extra packaging of products? Give your views or any relevant example with your own experience.
question_answer:
Over-packaging of products has become a trend in today's competitive world. Producers are trying to attract consumers with an attractive packaging of their products, not bothered about its negative impact not only on our environment but the users as well. It should be the responsibility of the producers to limit the wastage of the resources in the form of unnecessary packaging.  

The cost of over packaging is actually added to the product sold. In fact, at times it is seen the packing cost and durability is more that the product itself. The type of packaging found in pharmaceutical industries can be taken as an example here. Pills and tablets are found to be packed in much bigger and colourful strips than needed. Does this increase the sale of medicine? No. Such packaging is of no concern to the consumers. But, the cost of medicine would have definitely been lesser if sold in a simple outlook.

Further, the material used is mostly non-disposable which adds to the environmental pollution to a great extent. Snacks and other food items packaged in eye-catchy shimmering coloured packets are consumed on a large scale by everybody. These packets are really difficult to dispose of as they emit poisonous gas if burnt and if not can be seen to contaminate water somewhere. Producers should realise the importance of using materials like paper and stick to simple packaging.

Packaging as seen increases the cost of the product and also makes our environment unhealthy. So, this packaging boom should be checked on a serious note by the producers. Moreover, the producers should be restricted to predefined rules and parameters set by the government. It is also recommended that an awareness among the users that quality of the product is important rather than the attractive packaging.
